snippet: Trinity Mirror, the owner of tabloids including The Daily Mirror and The Sunday Mirror, said an inquiry had been opened into its criminal liability for the actions of former employees.
abstract: Britain's Trinity Mirror, publisher of tabloids including The Daily Mirror and The Sunday Mirror, says police are investigating whether the company is criminally liable for alleged phone hacking.
lead_paragraph: Trinity Mirror, the owner of tabloids including The Daily Mirror and The Sunday Mirror, said an inquiry had been opened into its criminal liability for the actions of former employees.

headline.main: Second Newspaper Group Under Inquiry in British Hacking Scandal
headline.print_headline: Britain: Publisher May Be Held Liable Over Phone Hacking

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
